question_text: A 22-year-old woman is evaluated for mild anemia.Peripheral blood smear is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is hereditary elliptocytosis (Option A). Hereditary elliptocytosis is a rare inherited disorder; clinical manifestations range from mild anemia with well-compensated hemolysis to severe transfusion-dependent hemolytic anemia with splenomegaly. The diagnosis is suggested by the presence of hemolytic anemia with elliptocytes (arrows) on peripheral blood smear.
